alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Ellis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:47PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Ellis and southwestern Dallas Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 746 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cedar Hill and another near Red Oak, both moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grand Prairie, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Lancaster, Waxahachie, Ennis, Midlothian, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Hutchins, Wilmer, Ovilla, Ferris, Palmer, Oak Leaf, Maypearl, Bardwell, Alma and Bardwell Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E between mile markers 390 and 416. Interstate 45 between mile markers 246 and 272. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
